title: 820-00239, Will not boot fully.
message:
I have a 13" touchbar here, it came in with liquid damage, and a blown J4402. The liquid damage was only seemingly to the touchbar connector J4402.

Replaced J4402, and patched up and ran a jumper wire to pin 22 of the connector due to a blown out trace.
Tried booting the laptop to High sierra or Mojave, and the macbook gets most the way through the apple logo and goes black, sometimes with crazy artefacts on the screen (patches of green.ect)
Passes apple hardware test with no issues found.

as it is a file vault encrypted SSD i am able to get to there logon screen and boot into guest user mode, Guest user mode seems to work, and with touchbar functionality.
It will boot into recovery without any issues and work in recovery just fine. It just wont make it into OSX, and looks allot like GPU failure.

title: 820-00239, Will not boot fully.
message:
Try your USB test OSX.
Need to discard software issue first...

title: 820-00239, Will not boot fully.
message:
Tried USB High Sierra and Mohave. 
It is definitely a hardware issue.
I have also tried the machine in a known good chasis with all known good parts.
It is a board fault.

title: 820-00239, Will not boot fully.
message: That is likely a CPU/GPU issue if you're getting artifacts. This can RIP.

title: 820-00239, Will not boot fully.
message:
There is no discrete GPU, only Intel graphics.
So RAM or CPU issue...

title: 820-00239, Will not boot fully.
message: Actually correction yes as 2informaticos said forgot 00239 is a 13". RAM or CPU which means junk pile
